bioghist.p: Charles James Rhoads (1872-1956) worked in the Banking Department of the Girard Trust Company. He was the first governor of the Federal Reserve Bank in Philadelphia. His association with Bryn Mawr College began in 1907 when he was elected a Member of the Trustees and later in 1936 became President of the Trustees and Chairman of the Board of Directors. He held both offices until his death.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Charles Rhoads. Materials include minutes of the Board of Trustees, financial statements, records relating to the selection of Katharine McBride as President of Bryn Mawr, records concerning the building of Rhoads Hall, and correspondence among members of the Board of Trustees. Notable correspondence includes a series of letters on the "faculty rebellion" of 1916 which arose after a professor was fired without the Board's input.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
